greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Product_{i=1..n} i / gcd(i,n).
comment: If p is prime, then a(p) = (p-1)!. - _Stefan Steinerberger_, Jun 08 2006
formula: a(n) = Product_{d|n} pxi(d), where pxi(m) = is the product of totatives of m (A001783). - _Jaroslav Krizek_, Dec 28 2016
maple: a:=n->mul(numer (k/n), k=1..n): seq(a(n), n=1..23); # _Zerinvary Lajos_, Apr 26 2008
mathematica: a[n_] := Product[i/GCD[i, n], {i, 1, n}]; Table[a[n], {n, 1, 30}] (* _Stefan Steinerberger_, Jun 08 2006 *)
Table[Product[Times @@ Select[Range@ d, CoprimeQ[#, d] &], {d, Divisors@ n}], {n, 23}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Dec 28 2016 *)
program: (MAGMA) [&*[&*[h: h in [1..d] | GCD(h,d) eq 1]: d in Divisors(n)]: n in [1..100]]; // _Jaroslav Krizek_, Dec 28 2016
results.author: _Martin Fuller_, Jun 06 2006
